alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 28 at 2:52PM MDT until March 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE PALMER DIVIDE AND DENVER METRO AREA...FIRE WEATHER ZONES 240...241...AND 247... The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 240 and 241. * Timing...11 AM to 7 PM MDT Thursday. * Winds...Southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. Strongest winds over the Palmer Divide are. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid outdoor burning and any activities that may produce sparks.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
